name: cross-laminated timber production | cross-laminated timber | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22451/documentation

This datasets represents the global production of Cross-laminated timber (CLT). Data are based on a sample of German Cross-laminated timber (CLT) produciton.;Cross-laminated timber (CLT) is a wood panel product made from gluing layers of solid-sawn timber together. Each layer of boards is oriented perpendicular to adjacent layers and glued on the wide faces of each board, usually in a symmetric way so that the outer layers have the same orientation. An odd number of layers is most common, but there are configurations with even numbers as well (which are then arranged to give a symmetric configuration).;Regular timber is an anisotropic material, meaning that the physical properties change depending on the direction at which the force is applied. By gluing layers of wood at perpendicular angles, the panel is able to achieve better structural rigidity in both directions. It is similar to plywood but with distinctively thicker laminations.;CLT is distinct to glued laminated timber, a product with all laminations orientated in the same way.;CLT production is geographically much focused on Alpine Europe, where the technology was originally developed. For example, Austria, Germany, and Switzerland together had almost 80% of global production capacity in 2015, whereby Austria alone holds 60% of global capacity (Muszynski et al., 2017). Other producing regions include France, the UK, Finland, Latvia, Japan, and the US.;The global annual production of CLT was estimated between 600,000 m3 in 2013 and one million m3 in 2015 (Muszynski et al., 2017). A future projection estimates that global production would reach three million m3 by 2025 (Muszynski et al., 2017). The global production volume for 2020 is therefore estimated to be roughly t wo million m3.;Reference(s):;Muszynski, Lech & Hansen, Eric & Fernando, Shanuka & Schwarzman, G. & Rainer, Jasmin. (2017). Insights into the Global Cross-Laminated Timber Industry.. BioProducts Business. 22. 77-92. https://www.researchgate.net/publication/321849166_Insights_into_the_Global_Cross-Laminated_Timber_Industry, accessed March 2020;Rüter, S. and S. Diederichs (2012): Ökobilanz-Basisdaten für Bauprodukte aus Holz. Arbeitsbericht aus dem Institut für Holztechnologie und Holzbiologie Nr. 2012/1, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut (vTI), Hamburg. ;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

From the reception at the factory gate of all materials and fuels used.

This activity ends with the standard forms of glued laminated timber produced at the factory gate. The dataset includes the inputs to and outputs of the production processes and the available process emissions. Infrastructure is a rough estimate.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials/1621:Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for Germany used for central Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology reflects a sample of German cross-laminated timber production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature; emissions profile per MJ wood input from PSI (2014)

exchanges.description:
Reference product. Plywood produced in Germany by processes representative for global average. The reference product is ready for delivery at the wooden board factory. 
A large number of materials can be produced with differing properties and areas of use. Typical uses are as construction plywood for wall, floor, and ceiling panels and also as panels for concrete shuttering, and decorative covering veneers in interior furnishings (e.g. wall panels or doors).

exchanges.description: Emission factor from DS "Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CH}| heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | Cut-off, U" on heat generation from industrial residual wood per MJ, multiplied by the input of wood fuel (direct wood fuel plus production residues ) scaled to reflect wood input per generated heat.

Emission factor from DS "Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CH}| heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | Cut-off, U" on heat generation from industrial residual wood per MJ, multiplied by the input of wood fuel (direct wood fuel plus production residues ) scaled to reflect wood input per generated heat.

Emission factor from DS "Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CH}| heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | Cut-off, U" on heat generation from industrial residual wood per MJ, multiplied by the input of wood fuel (direct wood fuel plus production residues ) scaled to reflect wood input per generated heat.

Emission factor from DS "Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CH}| heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | Cut-off, U" on heat generation from industrial residual wood per MJ, multiplied by the input of wood fuel (direct wood fuel plus production residues ) scaled to reflect wood input per generated heat.

Emission factor from DS "Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CH}| heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | Cut-off, U" on heat generation from industrial residual wood per MJ, multiplied by the input of wood fuel (direct wood fuel plus production residues ) scaled to reflect wood input per generated heat.

Emission factor from DS "Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CH}| heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | Cut-off, U" on heat generation from industrial residual wood per MJ, multiplied by the input of wood fuel (direct wood fuel plus production residues ) scaled to reflect wood input per generated heat.

Emission factor from DS "Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CH}| heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | Cut-off, U" on heat generation from industrial residual wood per MJ, multiplied by the input of wood fuel (direct wood fuel plus production residues ) scaled to reflect wood input per generated heat plus estimated emissions from wood and glue drying processes (according to Rüter & Diederichs 2012).
